question: 大文字
sourceMnemonic: You have <kanji>big</kanji> <kanji>writing</kanji> <kanji>letters</kanji>. What do you think these are? THAT WOULD HAVE TO BE <vocabulary>UPPERCASE LETTERS</vocabulary>, RIGHT? Whoops, sorry, caps lock was on for a moment, there.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. However, <ja>大</ja> uses the kun'yomi reading and <ja>文</ja> is an exception here, so here's a mnemonic to help you remember this:

Whenever you see an <vocabulary>uppercase letter</vocabulary>, you shout "<reading><ja>おお</ja></reading>, <reading>Moe</reading>!" (<ja>おおも</ja>). Your buddy Moe taught you the letters in the first place, so when you get stuck, you yell for him to come help you. And he always does. What a good guy.
